page.title: 06Sussex Game Farm, Kirdford.
page.content: The farmer has owned the farm for eight years. His house is ten years old. The farmer is also the managing director. They have 70 acres. The employees live locally. They have 2 sheep,9000 pheasants,4000 partridges,and ducks, geese and turkeys. He has pasture land but does not grow vegetables or fruit. The farmer hsa ten acres of woodland and he has five cattle buildings. They release half of the partridges and pheasants in the woods and the other half are left for next years birds. The birds that are released are shot during the winter as a sport for wealthy English gentlemen. They are then eaten.
